info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 11:34PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Rutherford, southwestern Cleveland, northeastern Spartanburg and northern Cherokee Counties through 1215 AM EDT... At 1134 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Gaffney, or near Cowpens National Battlefield, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gaffney, Boiling Springs NC, Blacksburg, Mayo, Chesnee, Earl, Cowpens National Battlefield, Lattimore, Mooresboro and Cliffside. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
